website_summaries.verdict: The Brother DSmobile 620 scanner is suitable for light-duty scanning as a portable or on the desktop, with simplex (one-sided), manual-feed scanning and a low price.
pros: Comes with capable document management software with built-in optical character recognition
cons: Although it comes with business card software, it doesn't handle business cards well

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare Software!!!! It ERASED my computer!
customer_reviews.text: Currently working on attempting to restore my computer. I downloaded the software that came with this scanner. I even paid the $10 for the BR-Receipts download. After getting everything downloaded I clicked on the BR-Receipts and it immediately popped up an error telling me to uninstall software and reinstall. I uninstalled it and watched as EVERYTHING on my computer was wiped out! Years of pictures of my 6 kids growing up, all of our travels, and every file pertaining to our home business ERASED!!! The software had attached itself to every document, picture, and file so when uninstalled it deleted everything. Currently on hour 2 of trying to restore my computer from right before installing this software. What a nightmare!
customer_reviews.author: Funshoppingmomma

customer_reviews.title: I went ahead and purchased this product. PLEASE NOTE ...
customer_reviews.text: I went ahead and purchased this product. PLEASE NOTE: This scanner ONLY works with Brother software. The BR-Receipts software that I purchased as an add on doesn't work well. Has many errors in it and the Brother development haven't updated the program in years. I was trying to use the receipt application on the MAC and I was forced to scan, save the file, then import it into the Receipts application. Their driver for this scanner doesn't appear in the MAC printers and scanners setting... therefore, you can't use it for other applications.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing scanning capability!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best buy I ever made. It's small so it doesn't take up much room. The scanning quality is amazing! When I sent some scanned old family pictures to my "Techie" brother he thought I bought a higher priced scanner. I love it and can scan just about any size up to 8 1/2" wide.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Weiler

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Open Source scanner software
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Linux and Windows. I would usually scan into TIFF and use Tesseract (command line OCR program from Google) to convert it to PDF. On Windows, I use "Not Another PDF Scanner 2" (NAPS2) instead of the programs provided by the Brother CD. NAPS2's is a lot more user-friendly for creating multi-page PDF/TIFF. On Linux, I use gscan2pdf. Gets the job done. One down side of the scanner for Linux is that the Linux SANE driver doesn't auto-crop like their Windows TWAIN driver, this makes batch jobs a little time consuming. I have yet to find a Linux set up that is streamline enough for creating multi-page PDF/TIFF.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Yu

customer_reviews.title: A Wast of Money...
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this scanner. It worked fine the first time I used it. I wanted it mainly for scanning photographs. So, after I removed it and stored in the little bag, and connected it a week later. I get a message that no scanner is connected. I chatted with Brother support, and they told me to do all the things I had already tried. I even went to their site thinking an updated driver would solve the problem. I still get the message that no scanner is connected. Plugged it into another USB port, and same problem. After reinstalling the drivers, thinking that would help, it's still not working.
customer_reviews.author: Millie Lee

customer_reviews.title: Hardware good, software major fail
customer_reviews.text: I installed the drivers from the enclosed CD, no scanner found. Deleted and downloaded the drivers from Brother thinking they'd be newer. No go. Contacted their customer support who ended up turning me over to a specialist who had to remotely access my laptop. She spent about an hour installing and uninstalling drivers until finally we got it to work. Once. As soon as I got home and tried to scan a photo, the same error messages appeared. I give full credit to their customer service who were friendly and helpful, but this scanner is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Michellemo

customer_reviews.title: This scanner is so AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is AMAZING!! I have scanned approx. 2000 photos and documents since purchasing just two weeks ago. It is extremely user-friendly, quiet and scans true to photo or document. Easily portable, lightweight, easy to install. We created workflows within the app that made scanning quick and easy. The only drawback is that after several hours of scanning, I advise shutting down and letting it cool off as it starts to glitch. We will not be without this scanner. It has made our geneological hobby so much easier!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, terrible software
customer_reviews.text: Great little scanner, with horrible software. Seriously, it's 2019, and printer and scanner software hasn't seemed to move past windows 98. Every time I plug this thing in and run the software it takes forever for the software to initialize, then it takes forever for the software to start scanning once it's initialized. Mind you, i'm using this on a very updated PC with SSDs, nothing should be this slow. An alternative option to the software would make this scanner fantastic. Sadly the software holds it down. It works, gets the job done, but if you're planning being a power user, you should probably look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use in my semi truck to scan the BOL to my company so I can get paid. The image quality is very good and the scanning is very quick. I'm using this with Win10 with no issues. I had to get the drivers from Brothers website because my laptop doesn't have a dvd drive. The drivers installes with no issues. I use the full version of Adobe Acrobat to scan the BOLs to pdf format and it works flawlessly with Adobe. The compact size is great for being inside of my truck which has limited storage. I would recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Rose

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as being compatible with Windows, Mac, and ...
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as being compatible with Windows, Mac, and Linux, this does not work with my Windows 10 machine, nor with my Linux machine. And yes, the Linux driver was properly installed. The XSane driver - provided by Brother on their website with detailed instructions for installation - doesn't even recognize the device is connected, though it works perfectly with a Canon flat-bed scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Seumas Mor

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the scans are terrible. Was going to use it for travel scanning ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a horrid scanner. Can not scan more than one page. If you do not have a cd dvd burner you can not load on half the drivers. The quality of the scans are terrible. Was going to use it for travel scanning but will simply throw it away. Not worth the price, not worth $10. Boo Brother yet another crappy product.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance J Malloy

customer_reviews.title: A solid 5 stars...
customer_reviews.text: Ignore all the people whining about the Brother software/drivers. There’s absolutely nothing wrong with the software nor drivers and customer support is awesome. A reminder to the whiners: You paid less than $100.00 for this so adjust your expectations accordingly. This scanner is super small, light weight and comes with a nice carrying pouch. I hooked it up to a 9 year old Mac laptop running Mojave version 10.14.5 and it operates flawlessly. Thank you for another great product at a great price Brother!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Download your Proper Operating Software First, 32 bit, 64 bit, Windows 10, 7, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I have Windows 10 64 bit and read a few reviews that stated this device doesn't work well with it. Just go to the Brother Download site for this DS-620, select your correct OS from their list, install the software BEFORE you connect your new device. Works great, selected PDF with Multiple Pages, lets you feed one at a time, select cancel once done with your scanned pages and check your PDF.
customer_reviews.author: Her and Him

customer_reviews.title: Not the best image quality; outdated software
customer_reviews.text: The scanning quality is about a 7 out of 10. I guess I should have expected that for the price. The software is a nightmare to download and the interface looks older than me. And I’m old. They want $10 to download the software to scan receipts after you register the device. That’s crazy; I’ll pass. I have been a fan of Brother products over the years, but I guess they haven’t kept up with the times. Disappointed but not worth the hassle to return. My phone camera takes better quality images than this scanner does.
customer_reviews.author: 🐼  Family

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little scanner
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is fabulous! It is small, portable, easy-to-use, high quality, and scans quickly. You just put your paper in, push the scanner's button and voila! It's sent to your computer. It's easy to scsan multi-page documents. You can also scan bulkier items, like ID cards, or envelopes. It's a little tricky to scan multiple receipts in the same image, since it's hard to get the ADF to pull in multiple items at the same time. But the little things you can either work around or let them go. This scanner saved me a lot of time and reduced a lot of paperwork for me. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Khosravi

customer_reviews.title: Works about 50% of the time
customer_reviews.text: I usually have to scan a document several times to get the whole document. It will skip a line in the middle of the document constantly.... Forget about doing a multi-page pdf, because every time there will be one of the pages that is not scanned properly. Now I'm getting a communication error. Wish I would have bought a protection plan or returned it right when I first noticed it. Not happy with it's performance whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE SUPPORT. If you have a machine running Windows ...
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE SUPPORT. If you have a machine running Windows 10, 64 bit, I would RUN. I have spent multiple chats and phone calls trying to resolve my issues. The scanner scans - but WTF - where does it go??????? Not on my desktop where they assure me it is, not in their app, not in my neat program. They asked me to uninstall for the (seriously), 10th time. I AM DONE. Next stop is to blast them on facebook and twitter.
customer_reviews.author: SeaCityAnon

customer_reviews.title: jams constantly
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of the Brothers scanner that worked great for 2-3 years before failing. It had a great feature "re-scan previous page" so if one page didn't scan properly you could easily just re-scan that page and keep using. This new one does not have that feature and jams constantly! I even replaced it with a new one, same problem. Terrible, I'm throwing this 2nd one in the trash and changing brands.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect when you have space constraints
customer_reviews.text: Love this little scanner. I use it for receipts and documents for my business. It scans quickly, quietly, and only needs the one single cord to run. This stores super easily in my laptop case. The fact that it comes with the clear "rider" or whatever you would call it, allows me to arrange multiple items next to each other and send them all through the scanner at once, rather than try and cut/paste on the computer. I'm not able to use the little scan button ON the machine, but the software that it comes with works fine, so it's no loss to me. Probably something I'm doing incorrectly anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Portable scanning option
customer_reviews.text: The scanner was exactly what I needed. A small portable unit that takes up little space and is portable but still provides decant scans of key documents. I have larger unit but find myself using this option because of its smaller footprint and use of use. It is a smaller unit and the speed and quality of the scan might not match larger and much more expensive units but for the money it does what I need
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on PC... Tip for MAC users
customer_reviews.text: On PC these work great. Make sure you have it plugged in to your machine BEFORE you open the application. Otherwise you will get an error. For MAC users, if you are getting an error message everytime you open the app, go to security, click the lock at the bottom and then hit allow for the scanner to be able to be used.
customer_reviews.author: J. Proffitt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have been working from home since Mid March and was not provided with a scanner (which we use often). Choose this due to affordability, reviews and recommendation via co-worker. Have had it a few months and am happy with it. You can only scan one page at a time but you can save multiple pages as one document. I gave it 4 stars due to having to reset it a time or two due to it thinking a paper was jammed. I am very happy with this purchase and the trips it has saved me to the office.
customer_reviews.author: Angela R

customer_reviews.title: These handle serious abuse and still provide great quality scans!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these in my office that we've used extensively for the last few years. I work in East Africa and often carry these when working in the field, scanning around 50-100 sheets per week. I'm amazed by what this little scanner can handle. We don't even use the carrier sheets unless a paper is an odd-size or wrinkled. My only recommendation is in case of heavy use, purchase additional carrier sheets since this only comes with one. They're expensive, but considering how long these scanners have lasted, they're worth the additional money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great little scanner, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is small and compact. I use this to scan receipts for my wife's business and the family medical reimbursements for our FSA. No power cord need since it's powered through the USB port. Extremely easy to use. Just click on the Brother scanner icon, load receipt, and choose which desktop folder that you have created to scan the receipt into and click scan. I use JPEG and works good. Easy to upload to any website. I do recommend buying a hard case for protection since the soft case doesn't offer any protection from accidental drops.
customer_reviews.author: Wattapunk

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with DSmobile Brother Scannes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and was running very well. As soon I have installed the version of MC OS Catalina 10.15.1 the Scanner is not working anymore. I have follow every recomendation from Brother's Scanners but always appear in my computer the message "fail to initialize". I am very disapointed with this situation. What can be done?
customer_reviews.author: JKoski

customer_reviews.title: I love the portability of this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love the portability of this scanner. We bought it because each of us (husband and wife) use different computers (PC & Mac). This one works on both where the other scanner we previously bought and returned only worked on one. It comes with a cloth, draw-string carry case. Nothing fancy but nice to be able to keep the scanner together with the cord. Con: When putting the paper (or ID card, etc.) into the scanner, you can feel the scanner 'accept/recognize' the paper in there but it does not automatically send it through, you still need to click the button. This is unlike other portable scanners I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: The Darn thing wont work with the lates MAC computer os, this thing was a waste of time
customer_reviews.text: the portable printer unfortunately has very poor software support did not work for my computer wish I knew it sooner, now it I have to go through the hassle of returning
customer_reviews.author: Deyvid Bitencout

customer_reviews.title: Took a bit, but works well
customer_reviews.text: It makes excellent scans for "desk docs" (eg, financial reports). It took a bit to find the right software path to set pdf vs jpeg, etc. Instructions could have been clearer. Actually, instructions to that function were completely missing, you have to explore that river all on your own. Product could really benefit from a "start here" page or two of the basics. You eventually get there, but only after hitting some snags. And maybe a piranha or two.
customer_reviews.author: DogFace

customer_reviews.title: I just scanned like a whole file cabinet worth of documents
customer_reviews.text: I just scanned like a whole file cabinet worth of documents. It took ~ 6 hours with this thing. It's great for portability and scanning like a few docs, but if you've got a big job or something, definitely worth it to get something with automatic feeding because loading the pages into this scanner isn't super easy. Quality not mind blowing or anything for b/w docs but it's alright considering it's significantly cheaper than other related items.
customer_reviews.author: Graycor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scanner
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this about 2 years ago for myself. I take it everywhere with me. No matter what job I'm working at, it sits on my desk. Make sure, if you purchase this - you get the "button manager", it makes scanning so much easier than just using the utility. Anyway, I love this product. I use it every day to scan receipts and invoices into QuickBooks, and I've used it to scan photos onto an external hard drive for a family reunion. I love that it auto-crops and doesn't require batteries to run (though it has to be plugged in). I liked this so much, I bought one for my mom for her birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: I first used this scanner at work and I loved it so much, I had to get one for home too! It is super easy to use, very user friendly and the scanned picture or document comes out perfect! You might have to play with how light or dark the image should be, but once you get it set, it's perfect!! If this review has helped you in any way, please click the YES button. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: BlueZebra

customer_reviews.title: Compact, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner. I bought it for business use and it has been a lifesaver. I mostly use it to scan and email documents. The scans are good and the device is compact, convenient, and super easy to take with me. It fits in my laptop case with it and came with it's own little cloth sack to carry it. I've had it for several months now, it's seen a ton of use, and not had any problems. The software that comes with it is pretty basic, but that is all I need, so it suits me just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kris KC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and compact to carry
customer_reviews.text: The scanner works quite well with the provided software. There's multiple scanning modes. My only complaint is that there is no mode like that on flatbed scanners where the page size is automatically detected by the scanner. Also, the longest paper size it can scan is just about 2 pages long. Being a feeder scanner, it would have been nice if it could scan longer pages, especially the long bills printed out at stores.
customer_reviews.author: eShopper

customer_reviews.title: A little tricky for someone who is not tech savvy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my dad who is not super tech savvy. Its okay, but he has difficulty loading the paper and connecting it. Small and portable- you can put it anywhere and it looks pretty sleek. I think he would just be more comfortable with the full page model scanners...
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: This scanner is a great buy and an awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little lightweight machine. Was a bit apprehensive after reading some review will all these installation issues. Don't know what the problem was, but I can tell you this little machine made our job so much easier and in half the time. Out of the box, plugged into the computer at the attorney's office and scanned over 250 pages in less than 90 minutes (that's with having to remove staples and taking papers out of binders and putting them back in during the process). Was praying for a no hassle machine, and can't say enough about this mobile scanner. Easy to take wherever you travel. Lightweight, worry-free. Definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: When the software actually works, it's a decent scanner
customer_reviews.text: This would be a decent scanner, but the software doesn't work 9 times out of 10. Sometimes, if you uninstall, download a new copy and reinstall, it will work, but not always. Most of the time, when you attempt to open the software, all you get is a popup that says "Supported Scanners: DS-620". I'm beyond dealing with the frustration on this and am about to take it outside and run it over with my car.
customer_reviews.author: Boatboy24

customer_reviews.title: Would not work with Mac iMac or MacBook Air
customer_reviews.text: I was able to download the software, but not matter what I did, the program would not open. The manual that comes with the scanner is pretty worthless and the on-line manuals not much more helpful. Sad. I love my Brother laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: then scan it and hope for the best. ABSURD
customer_reviews.text: Brother's tech support confirmed there is no way to adjust color, brightness, contrast, etc. while observing the changes. You must blindly make adjustments, then scan it and hope for the best. ABSURD!! Also, this model has the USB cable coming out the back of the unit, which gets in the way of papers being scanned. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jac Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great for Old Photos
customer_reviews.text: This little scanner has been amazing! My mom has boxes and boxes of old family photos that I’m worried will be lost forever if I didn’t scan them. This scanner has done an amazing job with Polaroids, 4x6”, and even photos from all the way back in the 40s. I highly recommend this for anyone looking for an inexpensive but quality scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Ball

customer_reviews.title: Returned-> unable to use with OSX 10.13
customer_reviews.text: Unable to get scanner to connect to Mac running High Sierra OSX 10.13.6. Tried CD that came with scanner, tried downloading a driver from Brother website, searched websites for updates. After an hour gave up, repackaged for return, printed return label, dropped off at UPS. We tried our best! but ultimately a FAIL.
customer_reviews.author: KOF

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is so portable and mostly stays stored away for only when necessary. It comes in clutch in a pinch and I don't have to keep taking my documents to work for scanning now. The system is easy to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Fiske

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner with a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty simple to use. Works through an app. Unfortunately, my Dell tablet doesn't recognize it's connected unless it's plugged in when I turn it on. That means if I decide I want to use it I have to plug it in and restart. Pretty inconvenient. But then, that could just be the result of using a government computer. But one thing I've also noticed is never scan black and white, even if you need your document in black and white. Go color and print in acrobat to black and white or you'll get a very poor scan on any image.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Small and Super User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have other scanners and all in one units but this is just what I needed to just scan without going across the room to remove and insert new items. Not much space on my desk as I have two desktops, 23" monitor, AB switch, keyboard, mouse and external hard drives. This little gem is wonderful and does a heck of a job. Eventually I may use it with my laptop. For now I am scanning old family photo's and documents and everything comes out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: My own

customer_reviews.title: Works Well for My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I had an older DS600 that died and found that Brother was now selling the newer DSmobile 620 and I think it is a vast improvement. Quality is very good and paper tracking is good as well. The capture software is a bit clunky until you figure it all out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: not a great scanner
customer_reviews.text: All of the programs come on a disk, My laptop doesn't have a cd-rom drive. I had to search to find the correct software on their horrible website. nothing I have ever tried to scan as ever come out good. I am very disappointed in this scanner. unfortunately it is past the window for me to return it AND i no longer have the box. I wouldn't buy this scanner if I where you. I had the epson Workforse DS-40 and it is 100% better.
customer_reviews.author: M Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Scan's true to color and very clear.
customer_reviews.text: The product is excellent, and worked prefect. Scan's true to color and very clear. The only reason why I returned it was because of where the cord is, the plug for the cord is setup directly behind it the scanner, where the paper would scan thru. After returning it, I look at many other brands and notice that they all have the plug and cord setup the same way from the back. I will purchase this again, maybe when the company relocates the plug and cord to the side of the scanner and not where it's located now. Brother is an excellent product and great customer service too.
customer_reviews.author: Lil

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with MacOS High Sierra
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is completely incompatible with MacOS High Sierra. There is a page on Brother's Web site that says a driver is coming in "late Oct." As of 27 October 2017, the scanner is still completely useless with my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hart

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable purchase for photo scanning
customer_reviews.text: see uploaded picture. With my particular scanner, every time there is a flat gradient being scanned, like a sky or a wall in the picture, the scanner likes to put random waves of dark and light in vertical and horizontal patterns. The scan software is incredibly cheap, few options for scanning. It tends to dose every scan in an abnormal amount of contrast.. which is ideal for a document but not for scanning pictures. Save your money for something more reliable and put together by people with self respect.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great scanners! Way too restrictive order limit!
customer_reviews.text: The scanners are great little machines. I purchased 5 for office staff to use with tablets while traveling. My fault with this order is that I needed 5 units, one for each staff member (5 different locations within the State), and I was only able to purchase 2 from any given vendor (not just in a single order, but for all orders at a vendor!) - and believe me I tried all over including @ Brother. I have no idea why there is such a restriction on the purchase of these things, but it is a huge, huge nuisance!
customer_reviews.author: Deb L

customer_reviews.title: Good Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Good scanner for basic needs. Love that it is very portable and can be stored away when not in use. My only gripe is that the quality of the scan. At basic setting of 300 DPI/color the whites of the paper is fuzzy which is a result of the scanner not being pressed against the paper as it scans. This fix to this issue is to double up on paper so as to increase the thickness of what you are scanning. I will upload a before an after.
customer_reviews.author: EABC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use out of the box - need to go download the software though
customer_reviews.text: This scanner worked perfectly out of the box. It's not made super clear in the directions, but you do need to go to the website to download the proper software. Once installed, using it was a breeze. Due to the pandemic and working from home, I needd a scanner but didn't want yet another bulky piece of equipment. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Good, small scanner
customer_reviews.text: This fulfilled our needs for a hard-copy scanner. It's not intended, or made, for high throughput use. But, for occasional scanning, it's working out okay. It was a bit difficult to figure out how to use the software; especially how to specify where the scanned file is stored. Once that was mastered, it's been a good thing for us.
customer_reviews.author: Portland Fella

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, terrible software. Very windows 95-esque.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with the Windows 10 "Windows Scan" app. Default software has an ancient Windows 95-like user interface that has unacceptable settings as default (seriously, 100dpi jpg?) which isn't acceptable in 2018. On Brother's website, there is marginally better software ("Button Manager") which once configured makes it /ok/, but not great. Very confusing to setup at first glance, or second glance for that matter. Hardware is decent though. Hasn't jammed once yet.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: portable must have
customer_reviews.text: must download brother's utilities other than that this is very portable and fits in my small backpack (15.5 laptop size) it was a great price, i don't have a higher model to compare it to but for me i was able to scan with maybe one time asking me to open the cover and fix a paper jam (without a jam) no biggy easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Jen U

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for photos
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scanner! I purchased it because my in-laws have thousands of photos that were damaged in the floods in Michigan and after we cleaned them up, I wanted to get them digitized. So far I’ve scanned about a thousand photos over the course of about 5 hours. The picture quality is excellent, it scans quickly, and the software is easy to use. I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Bridgetem

customer_reviews.title: Brother is a must
customer_reviews.text: so far it’s held up and I’ve had no issues with the software like other reviewer’s have mentioned I have not had to call tech-support at the moment but I’m sure that they’re based in China, all around this product works it’s lightweight extremely portable and gets the job done highly recommended. Will update further if I run into any issues
customer_reviews.author: Travis Davies

customer_reviews.title: This scanner crashes non-stop on macs, with the latest ...
customer_reviews.text: This scanner crashes non-stop on macs, with the latest OX and software update with error code 2023, for which there is no reference on the brother website. A bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Alex D

customer_reviews.title: The scanner never connect to computer
customer_reviews.text: Either Mac 10.14 or Windows10, the scanner never connected to the computer instantly. I had to keep reinstall the program and driver several times whenever I need to scan for something. I used it about 5 times after we purchased it 8 month ago. I am pending average 5 hours to get it work whenever I use it. This time, even reinstalling the driver and program didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: underheaven

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, easy to use perfect for small desk. Works great love that you can adjust the size. Perfect to scan cards.
customer_reviews.author: W.J Cabada

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my PC laptop
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my PC laptop, getting all power from a USB port. Power operates both the scan electronics and motor driving paper through the scanner. Software loaded onto PC laptop allows single page PDFs, multi-page PDFs and JPEG formats from scans. On multi-page docs, software allows up to 30 seconds to load next page, but will proceed as soon as you click on scan soft-button. Scan image quality is very good, with scan files being sequentially numbered and loaded into MyScans directory from which they should be renamed and moved. The scanner comes with a USB connector cable, DVD with software, nylon fabric carrying case and small manuals. Another nifty product from Brother.
customer_reviews.author: T. Schneck

customer_reviews.title: "Paper jam" for longer receipts
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for longer receipts. It would stop scanning and display an error message "paper jam". However, the paper was not jammed. It would always stop at about the 18 inch mark. So shorter receipts and paper would work but nothing longer. It claims to be able to do 32 inches. I am running Windows 10, 64 bit. I updated to the latest drivers found on the Brother support website. I tried 2 different scanning programs they offered. Both resulted in the same error.
customer_reviews.author: R Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to understand how to use the Preview feature: One moves the parameters and the document appears. Kind of expected the document to appear after scanning in preview mode, then crop with the parameter settings. But scanning is good. All scans go to the same folder, then one can rename them and move them within one's own online filing system.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix K

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Little Scanner A+
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little scanner that fits easily in a laptop bag with your computer. It scans 600 dpi in color creating Pdf or Jpeg files up to 8-1/2 X 11. I quit using my table top scanner. This one is quicker and easier to use for high quality document scans.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Houghton

customer_reviews.title: Love This Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: I was used to the slower bed type flat scanners, and I bought this one to use in my home office. Bullet proof software, super fast, and great quality scans. Works like a charm. Surprisingly heavier than it looks, but overall a very well made, easy to use scanner. USB powered, and cable is included.
customer_reviews.author: M. Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 15 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 15 months. Then started to show error message "does not initiate". De-installed drivers, installed again, with no result. Using with MacBookAir. MacOS Catalina 10.15. Would like my money back if possible.
customer_reviews.author: P.J. de Bruin

customer_reviews.title: Needs more complete information
customer_reviews.text: Described as being Mac compatible. However, without drivers it really isn't. My Mac is running OS Catalina, and Brother has no drivers for it with this scanner. Bummer! More information instead of less would've assisted me in purchasing the right scanner the first time. Tip: Visit website of product before purchasing to confirm drivers & firmware available before purchasing if they will be required to use it. This product as of today DOES NOT WORK WITH MACS RUNNING CATALINA OS
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: ideal small scanner.
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than I thought it would be! It was easy to set up and it works perfectly and quickly. It is so tiny, it can be kept anywhere. I don't use it regularly, so I keep it in a desk drawer most of the time, more to keep the cod out of the socket than to get the scanner off my desk. It comes with everything you need, including a clear plastic sleeve for scanning small items. My husband has a giant flatbed scanner and I like this one much better!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Get Your Money's Worth!
customer_reviews.text: Got my $100 worth the first day using this! With plans to move and wanted to move less items, we decided to go through pictures and scan them since we dont pull them out anymore to look through them. I was able to scan hundreds in a few hour compared to a flatbed where it would have taken all weekend. By the time I was done, over 2500 pictures were scanned quickly. Now, we have saved ourselves an unknown amount of pounds of pictures to move.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Love the
customer_reviews.text: I purchase the scanner primarily for scanning photos. It doesn't outstanding job of scanning the software that's included is very good and allows you to do continuous photos although every time you close the program and reopen it it starts with image zero zero zero one so if you're not careful you will have lots of the same named photos. I didn't see a way in the software to change this. But I would definitely buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon.Fan

customer_reviews.title: IMPORTANT TO KNOW
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS SCANNER, EASY ON MACBOOKAIR RETINA 2020, JUST DOWNLOAD THE APP AT APPSTORE AND FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS. IMAGE IS EXCELLENT AND IT HAS ITS OWN FOLDER. I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Dainier Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Faulty feeder causes distorted scanned images
customer_reviews.text: The scanner snags the right corner of my page, which causes the whole sheet to turn and slide warping the scanned image. I have to scan multiple times and pray that it will feed straight to get the pages scanned without distortion. Incredibly frustrating. Will have to purchase another scanner.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Bourne

customer_reviews.title: Fails to meet the single purpose of my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Business card scanning. Unbearably poor performance. "first.lastname@biz.com" is a basic email format. Yet, when I scan a card it "scans" it as fhflkjh6974947kjfhkajfh@name;moc. Don't go cheap. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Shammy

customer_reviews.title: Need software drivers
customer_reviews.text: It worked great until Apple upgraded the software for my computer. Still don't have drivers for the new software and it's been a month. The software brother has on their website doesn't work for Apple's new software.
customer_reviews.author: Ugene

customer_reviews.title: Great at first but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scanner for less than 2 years and I have only scanned around 25 documents total. I use it often during tax season but this year when I went to use it, the rollers that help feed the paper through were jammed. I followed the trouble shooting tips provided by Brother and they didn't work. I reached out to their support only to have them recommend the same article and then suggest I check if it's in warranty. It's not. Now it functions as a bulky paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Good portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: Good portable scanner. At first I was having trouble because the papers I was trying to scan would show up black with weird white marks, and I was confused because the configuration page was turning out perfect. After working with it a little, I realized that because the documents were old and the paper wasn’t completely white, The scanner couldn’t pick it up under the black and white setting. After switching to color it worked perfectly! I love that it came with a protective cover for the documents, and a nice sleeve for the scanner itself. Overall I am very satisfied with this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Stefania C.

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner.
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner! I have tons of receipts, invoices, etc that I scan an put in the cloud for my bookkeeper to enter into our accounting system. It is so simple and works so well. It is a one page at a time and comes with a few different plastic sheets that you can put small receipts or notes in and scan them. If you need an auto feeder then its not for you but otherwise it is great. One of the best purchases I Have ever made on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MACHINE TO HAVE IN YOUR HOME!
customer_reviews.text: I MUST SAY THAT THIS WONDERFUL LITTLE MACHINE IS A MUST+++ TO HAVE IN YOUR HOME... BEST OF ALL..IT'S VERY PORTABLE AND DOESN'T REQUIRE YOU TO BUY BATTERIES. NOW I DON'T HAVE TO PAY $1.00 FOR EVERY SINGLE DOCUMENT THAT I FAX! THIS MACHINE WILL SAVE YOU MONEY AND SAVE YOU LOTS OF HEADACHES! CAN SCAN DOCUMENTS IN ALL FORMATS: PDF, JPEG,GIF,TIFF.
customer_reviews.author: Oneida Y. Turcios-Wong

customer_reviews.title: Does a simple task and does it well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to scan receipts. I had been doing it on a limited basis using my phone or a high end platform scanner, but both of those have problems scanning long receipts. They also take a lot more time than this. Setup is easy. Get the brother software installed from their website, plug it in, and you're ready. I have mine configured so that pressing the one button on it automatically scans it into a Dropbox folder for later processing. Small receipts can be a bit fickle but still quicker than an app, even if you have to redo it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: IOwnCalculus

customer_reviews.title: Does a nice job, very portable
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I could not use Adobe Acrobat's direct scan function with this, meaning I was forced to use the proprietary scan software that comes with the scanner. It is very basic and not especially intuitive. Would rate higher if better driver support.
customer_reviews.author: J Moore

customer_reviews.title: Compact, quiet. Scan to PDF best setting.
customer_reviews.text: I predominantly wanted this scanner to scan medical receipts, bills, statements, etc. I opted to download and install the latest driver from the Brother website, rather than use the accompanying CD. It was easy to find on the Brother site and easy to install. By default, the scanner software wants to scan the document as a JPEG. Even on the highest (600dpi) resolution, the quality of a document scanned to JPEG was poor. However, a 600dpi PDF had excellent contrast and readability. I really like how compact, quiet, and easy-to-use this scanner is. I also like that it is USB powered. For the price, I think this was a perfect purchase for my needs..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: If you are wanting a real scanner, don't get this. This product is horrible. If you don't care about a quality scan where you can actually read small text from a scanned document, then this is for you. If you do care about quality, then stay away from this scanner. It's like a kids toy. I need something that works and works well. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this to start scanning in documents of a family member to get ready to move them to an assisted living. This was GREAT, I could get the papers and take the scanner with me to the firehouse and work on it when I had time. The foot print of this was small and hardly noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Haskett

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: Good little machine only con I found is that u can't have ANY creases in the receipts I run thro or u can barely read them.
customer_reviews.author: ky

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible macOS 10.14.6 Mojave
customer_reviews.text: My scanner just came today, obviously a 2018 MacBook Pro does not have a CD drive, so I was forced to download the drivers from Brother website. DSmobileCapture is listed for 10.14, however is not compatible with 10.14.6 Mojave. A constant "initialize failed" error message is received. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Leinhauser

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this! I had to scan a bunch of ...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! I had to scan a bunch of photos for our school's slideshow and it made my job so easy. I scanned 100's of personal photos also and only had the line through them once and just cleaned it and it is going great again. This minor problem is definitely not a reason to keep anyone from buying it. I love the fact that you don't have to plug it into the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Griffith

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted one of these for years! It has done really well so far. I have scanned many types of items and so far it has handled all except a very unusually long receipt. (Like CVS long... ;) ) I have gotten my money's worth so far!
customer_reviews.author: MomofNine

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRICE, PORTABILITY A+
customer_reviews.text: This item is perfect for remote work. You can scan 1 page at a time. Also you can print if necessary, printing isn't cost effective but a great option in a pinch. Inexpensive, easy to store or take with you. Fits in my laptop bag!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Hennessy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for on the go scanning
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is great for on the go! I found the set up to be quick and easy. I have a Microsoft Surface, and I was set up and scanning in under 10m. A point to note, this scanner only does one page at a time. You can scan multiple pages, but you have to feed them one at a time. It also saves them as individual pdf documents. However, if you are just an at home user, like I am, scanning receipts, vet records, etc- this is exactly what you need!
customer_reviews.author: Nasennak

customer_reviews.title: ... leave feedback unless an item is off the charts amazing or a dud
customer_reviews.text: I don't typically leave feedback unless an item is off the charts amazing or a dud. This portable Brother scanner is definitely the former of the two. My favorite aspect is that not only can you save the document as a TIFF, JPEG, or BMP file, but you can also save it as a PDF indirectly. All you have to do is choose printer as your option. Then, configure the printer option to save as microsoft PDF. Voila! No need to convert JPEG to PDF now. Hope you consider this product if you are in need of a light weight scanner that carries a compact punch.
customer_reviews.author: yberry

customer_reviews.title: Great for digitizing old photos!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a life saver for my family photo project! Being able to put memory book pages in the sleeve to protect them has made my job so much faster! I still have some scrap bok pages that won't fit, but the scans come out clear and here isn't damage to my grandparents old photos! It makes my job so much faster!
customer_reviews.author: ValaSargent

customer_reviews.title: I was able to get it to work without issue.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. You will have to set up the provided software. You might have to save your setting twice for them to work - I had to. Once set, scans to pdf without issue. No reason, that I can see, to load any third party software.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Lazy

customer_reviews.title: While the scanner is good, I could not recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: While the scanner works well and seems sturdy and effective, the software program that comes with it is highly ineffective. It often will not save the image to the designated file. You then have to do a search and personally move the image to the correct file. Big time waster!!! Manufacture has done nothing to improve their software. I think it is sad that a good product in not supported by quality software or made to work with other software programs. This program really slows down productivity.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: This was very disappointing. I bought it to be able to edit pdf documents. After searching through amazon for scanners with software for editing capabilities this one seemed to be able to do the job. unfortunately it did not. After downloading the software it was said to need to be updated, after updating the software it did not work with my computer. I tried to reach customer support that was no help as they sent me to the website which has no information. I returned it after getting nowhere which is sad because I needed a scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner - so easy to set up just plug in and upload the software. It works with a pdf program easily - no brainer. Just feed the page through into a file or through the pdf program and create a file. If it sticks just open the top take out and try again. can have tape on the page and goes through easily. I have had folded page go through easily. Remove staple and go. I have set up my bookkeeping business to be paperless with the power of this tool. It is big enough to work and small enough to easily travel in my mobile office bag. LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Loved how easily you can get a flow going. The pictures come out great and software was good. I am happy with this product~ Not bad for the price I paid~
customer_reviews.author: MamaSheree

customer_reviews.title: Software not updated, can't use scanner
customer_reviews.text: Scanner Driver, TWAIN is not supported by macOS v10.15.3, which make this scanner useless to my Mac book. It doesn't work. (bought 2/9/2020, Mac OS updated to v10.15.3, Brother doesn't have updated software, which make this scanner useless.)
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Le

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Portable Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Quick and reliable. Image quality is excellent and the software by Brother is actually very useful. The default software is very basic but the Button Manager V2 software makes scanning to a folder, ftp, e-mail, printer, or network share a simple one click. This has made it very easy to scan in multipage PDF docs or TIFFs of old photos. It has a default length limit and I was even able to adjust a button to a "Long Receipt" which accepts 30 inches worth of paper. Great quality product!
customer_reviews.author: M. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great convenient scanner with well paired software
customer_reviews.text: Love this scanner! Pros: -Software is built amazingly. One click on the device will automatically save your scan to your photos folder, works on Win 10! -Hardware is great, scanner will automatically pull through your paper to lock in place before scan is initiated -Super portable -Software will also attach the picture to whatever application you're using, as long as you have that window active. It'll also save a copy in your pictures folder. Cons: -Image quality is slightly low.. zooming in on pictures will show some pixelation
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a champ. Had an issue with my Surface 5 recognizing the scanner right away but a reboot fixed that problem. Scanned photos and documents pretty fast and fairly accurate color representation. I'm very happy with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: TimATX

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as it looked like it would be easy to use and store. Setup was very easy and fast. Using it was self-explanatory. Scans quickly although it does have a 30 second delay after scanning the last page (I guess to allow for any other pages). I would like a way to skip that. Multiple page scanning is very easy. Let's you name the file and location where to store. I have only done documents at this time, so not sure how well photos do. I would recommended.
customer_reviews.author: south81

product_meta.title: Brother DS 620 Sheetfeed Scanner
product_meta.description: Brother DS620Z1 - DS-620 A4 Mobile Document Scanner - A4 Mobile Document Scanner. 8ppm Colour 600 dpi 1 Year RTB Warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,346 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
